body.p:
Madisonville Ky Novr. 25th 1863
To his Excellency Thos. E Bramlett Govr. of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

The undersigned Would respectfully represent with your Excellency that at the present ^Novr^ May term of the Hopkins Circuit Court the confessed Judgt upon an Indictment against "him in said Court for failing to obtain "a copy of the table of Tavern Rates from "the County Court Clerk and set up the "same in the public room of his tavern "house" He states that he was Indicted at the May term of sd. Court 1863 That the Civil law previous to that time in 1861 and 1862 had to a great extent been suspended a good portion of the time there was no clerk of sd. County Court He states however as a reason Why he did not obtain said Tavern Rates and set them up, he did not know the law required it of a Tavern keeper. He did not intend to violate the law. Having been engaged in the business but a short time he was not posted. He prays your excellency to remit the fine, It being $75.00 He says that he obtained the License required by the law and in all other respects
complied with the law to the best of his knowledge & ability
The undersigned citizens of Madisonville & vicinity would state that Jas. T Lawton is a quiet, sober law abiding citizens & we would be pleased that his fine should be remitted

J. B. Earle
Wm L. Gorron
O. Waddill
Geo. W. Noel
J M Compton
Dick Littlepage

Hopkins Cir Ct
vs
Jas T. Lawton
Tipling
15th Jany/ 64

Remit all except costs & fees
Tho E Bramlette
